subject: Sales
title: Win-Win Is Not a Cliche
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Win-Win Is Not a Cliche.

hook.text: A supplier slashes prices to keep a client. Next year the client demands more cuts. Both lose.

buildup.text: Win-lose deals feel clever short term. But the losing side always finds a way to get even later.

discovery.text: Harvard's Negotiation Project proved win-win deals last longer and create more total value.

twist.text: Win-win doesn't mean splitting everything equally. It means each side gets what they value most.

climax.text: A buyer who gets fast delivery and a seller who keeps margin both win. Value is not a fixed pie.

punchline.text: Win-win isn't soft. It's the only deal that sticks.

quiz.question: Why do win-lose deals often fail long term?
options: The losing side finds a way to get even
